defence secretary during much of the Vietnam war, who was later very open about his regrets, Donald Rumsfeld is unrepentant. In the book and in conversation, he presents the Iraq war as justified and ultimately successful. Is our country and region better off with Saddam Hussein gone? he asks me briskly, before answering his own question. ''You bet.''
